title: Sempra Energy to sell interest in businesses in Peru for $3.59 billion to China Yangtze Power
text: Sempra Energy SRE, -0.17% announced Monday a deal to sell its interests in its Peruvian businesses for $3.59 billion in cash to China Yangtze Power International Co. Ltd. 600900, +0.16%, subject to closing adjustments. The deal includes Sempra's sale of its 83.6% stake in Luz del Sur S.A.A., as well as its interest in Tecur S.A. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of 2020. The company continues to pursue a sale of its electric businesses in Chile. Separately, Sempra said its subsidiary Sempra LNG has entered into a memorandum of understanding with China Yangtze Power-parent China Three Gorges Corp. regarding potential cooperation in supplying liquefied natural gas in China. The stock, which was still inactive in premarket trading, has run up 33.5% year to date, while the S&P 500 SPX, -0.53% has climbed 18.2%.
description: Sempra Energy announced Monday a deal to sell its interests in its Peruvian businesses for $3.59 billion in cash to China Yangtze Power International Co....
